sentences.text: A model-based approach to on-line cursive handwriting analysis and recognition is presented and evaluated .
In this model , on-line handwriting is considered as a modulation of a simple cycloidal pen motion , described by two coupled oscillations with a constant linear drift along the line of the writing .
By slow modulations of the amplitudes and phase lags of the two oscillators , a general pen trajectory can be efficiently encoded .
These parameters are then quantized into a small number of values without altering the writing intelligibility .
A general procedure for the estimation and quantization of these cycloidal motion parameters for arbitrary handwriting is presented .
The result is a discrete motor control representation of the continuous pen motion , via the quantized levels of the model parameters .
This motor control representation enables successful word spotting and matching of cursive scripts .
Our experiments clearly indicate the potential of this dynamic representation for complete cursive handwriting recognition .

kg2text: The innovative approach to on-line cursive handwriting analysis and recognition, described by two coupled oscillations with a constant linear drift along the line of writing, enables successful word spotting and matching. This motor control representation quantizes cycloidal pen motion parameters without altering intelligibility, allowing for accurate recognition. The model-based method modulates slow movements to encode general pen trajectories, representing handwriting as a modulation of simple cycloidal pen motions. Our experiments demonstrate the potential of this dynamic representation in recognizing complete cursive handwriting.

The study presents a general procedure for estimating and quantizing cycloidal motion parameters in cursive handwriting, applicable to arbitrary handwriting styles. This involves two coupled oscillations with a constant linear drift along the line of writing, which exhibit slow modulations of amplitudes and phase lags. The result is a discrete motor control representation of continuous pen motion, achieved through the quantization of cycloidal model parameters.
